stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).

stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è Live from the Glowstone Terrace! The Rubber Match! üéôÔ∏è

Hello everybody, I'm your host Nok the Corrupter, the demon who's seen it all and survived the Demon Prison just to bring you the most bone-shattering, soul-splintering action in Osterra! We are coming to you live from the shimmering Glowstone Terrace for Game 3 of this Winners Bracket showdown! The air is thick with the scent of mountain wind and the greasy smell of the Market Day Crowd! It‚Äôs all tied up at 1-1, and the loser of this Best of 3 goes straight to the Losers Bracket, likely to hang out with those shimmering disappointments, the Haven Lights! Ha!

I just saw Ladew Evelina of the Confluence Captains chugging her raw egg‚Äîshell and all‚Äîand folks, she‚Äôs got a look in her eye that says 'I‚Äôm here to crack skulls and collect coins!' Meanwhile, Zadoc Wyatan of the Tamers is passing around that communal cup of non-alcoholic grog. A bit too sober for my tastes, but if it helps them handle the Glowstone Glare, who am I to judge? I even spotted Chairman Brennen Farno in the VIP box, looking as strangely beautiful and kissless as ever! He‚Äôs probably here to see if he can tax the blood spilled on the field today!

The popularity of these Captains is soaring like a Guild Skyport vessel, while the Tamers are about as well-liked as a case of the Nether-Chills. But as my boss Lord Orzalon always says, 'Popularity doesn't save your skin in a pit fight!' Will the Captains use their home-field advantage and the sticky tree sap on Vonni Geoff‚Äôs arms to seize the day, or will the Tamers silence the crowd? Let's get to the carnage! Play ball!
postGame:
# üèÜ TAMERS TAKE THE SERIES! 2-0 SHUTOUT IN THE FINALE! üèÜ

Holy mackerel, sports fans! What a defensive masterpiece we just witnessed at the Glowstone Terrace! The Oread's Summit Tamers have come into the heart of the Guild of the Black Sky and walked away with a 2-0 victory, clinching the series 2-1! It wasn't the high-scoring fireworks of Game 2, but it was a masterclass in physical persuasion and tactical brutality! The Captains are heading to the Losers Bracket, and I haven't seen this much disappointment in Confluence since Nikos Thanae ran out of people to shoot in the street! Ha!

The scoring started early and ended early, folks! Odericus Juxon‚Äîwho I saw slapping her own helmet until her ears rang during the warm-up‚Äîfound herself in the Home Field zone and decided she didn't want to run. She launched a beautiful 2-point shoot that sailed through the uprights before the Captains' defense even knew the ball was live! That was all the scoring we'd see, but by the Abyss, the violence was just getting started!

The Captains tried to mount a response, but their offense was more stagnant than a swamp in Mellondor. Deach Sharlene picked up the ball in Center Field, but the Tamers' defense closed in like a closing soul contract! Every time the Captains tried to advance, they were met with a wall of mountain muscle. Stephan Lisk tried to tackle Alwyn Wandy, but Alwyn‚Äîthe one who whispers fears to the ball‚Äîblocked it like he was swatting a fly!

The first half saw some real beautiful clinical work. Richia Pazit, apparently tired of headbutting the goal post, decided to headbutt Alwyn Wandy‚Äôs ribs instead, sending them to the healer's tent with a sickening crunch! Not to be outdone, Edme Virgil of the Tamers‚Äîprobably singing a sea shanty under their breath‚Äîleveled Carnahan Laud. The Captains looked lost, even with Vonni Geoff‚Äôs arms covered in sticky sap; they just couldn't keep a grip on the game!

We saw a flash of brilliance from the Captains when Carnahan Laud intercepted a wild pass from Zadoc Wyatan, but the momentum was short-lived. The halftime whistle blew, and Kant Langill had his work cut out for him trying to piece the Captains back together. I‚Äôm sure he did a clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints,' but the only thing loose in that locker room was the Captains' morale!

The second half was a literal bloodbath, just the way I like it! Mitran Mariand started the party by injuring Stephan Lisk. Then Edme Virgil decided Deach Sharlene‚Äôs boots were on the wrong feet and helped him horizontal with a thunderous tackle! The Captains were dropping like flies! Kass Fogel joined in, injuring Vonni Geoff and sending another Captain to the sidelines. It was beautiful, simply beautiful!

Swamy Ahasuerus, fresh from dipping her hands in ice water, used those numb fingers to absolutely wreck Belding Chloe. I guess rubbing the ball on your armpits doesn't help when you're being driven into the polished Glowstone! The Captains' stars were being systematically dismantled. Even O'Conner Maighdlin, who spent the pre-game rhyming, couldn't find a verse to save him from Zadoc Wyatan‚Äôs wrath. Zadoc injured him so badly he likely forgot how to speak entirely!

Clippard Burr put the final exclamation point on the carnage by injuring Stephan Lisk again! Talk about a rough day at the office! And just for good measure, Dric Trilley‚Äîthe grocery list reciting queen‚Äîsent Behl Berstine to the dirt with a season-ending injury. The Captains' bench was looking thinner than the air at Oread's Summit! They were so drunk on their own popularity they forgot you actually have to survive the game to win it!

Even with the Guild of the Black Sky watching, the Captains couldn't buy a goal. They had possession late with Ladew Evelina, but the Tamers' defense was an impenetrable fortress. The Mountain Wind might have been at the Captains' backs, but the Tamers had the iron in their souls! I bet Chairman Toland is going to need a lot of cheese and a good bake to get over this embarrassing loss!

So the series ends! The Oread's Summit Tamers advance in the Winners Bracket, proving that grit beats glamour every time! The Confluence Captains will have to lick their wounds and prepare for the long climb back from the Losers Bracket. My favorite Ebon Gate Corruptors are surely smiling at this display of utter dominance! The 'heroes' like Sir Artorias probably think this was too 'violent,' but we know better, don't we Osterra?

Final Score: Oread's Summit Tamers 2, Confluence Captains 0! Tamers win the series 2-1! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the Glowstone Terrace! I‚Äôm going to go see if I can find where Ladew Evelina keeps her egg stash. Stay brutal, stay bloody, and keep your eyes on the ball!
